content: Yep, the emoluments clause is a murky grey area, so let’s go back in time 8 years and see if we clear it up a bit… Barak Obama has just entered office and he has allowed a local hotel to use his name, “The Obama Suites”. Full disclosure shows that no money has exchanged hands for this unprecedented use of a presidents name, but it’s assumed that there is a “wink and a nod” agreement for some future compensation. To curry favor with the new president, foreign diplomats stay at the suites and make sure that the president knows they are doing that. Democrats are fine with this, even though there is some obscure clause in the constitution that might make it unconstitutional… One alternate reality away and 8 years in the past, and I can still hear the republicans squealing like stuck pigs!
